questions.question: What is the chemical formula for MWM-1 (Co/2Ni)?
What method was used for the absorption correction of MWM-1 (Co/2Ni)?
What is the maximum and minimum transmission (Tmin, Tmax) values for MWM-1 (Co/2Ni)?
How were the H-atom parameters treated in the refinement of MWM-1 (Co/2Ni)?
What is the relationship between the crystal structure of MWM-1 (Co) and MWM-1 (Co/2Ni)?
questions.answer: MWM-1 (Co/2Ni) and MWM-1 (Co) exhibited the same structures, apart from some Co(III)/Co(II) ions being substituted with Ni(III)/Ni(II) ions.

questions.question: What effect does Ni doping have on the conductivity of MWM-1 (Co)?
questions.answer: Ni doping of MWM-1 (Co) significantly improves its conductivity, making MWM-1 (Co/2Ni) a semiconductor with a conductivity of 10^-6 S m^-1.

questions.question: True or False: The synthesis method of MWM-1 (Co/2Ni) allows for the controllable growth of conductive MOF crystals.
True or False: MWM-1 (Co/2Ni) maintains the SMM characteristics of the parent MWM-1 (Co) due to the strong anisotropic interactions between Co and Ni ions.
What is the role of the [Ni3(H2O)2]2+/[Co3(H2O)2]2+ subunits in the energy storage mechanism of MWM-1 (Co/2Ni)?
questions.answer: The [Ni3(H2O)2]2+/[Co3(H2O)2]2+ subunits are the key structures that trigger the electrochemical activity, leading to charge storage through the nickel/cobalt redox reaction.

questions.question: True or False: The performance of MWM-1 (Co/2Ni) supercapacitors can be adjusted by changing the amount of Ni doping.
